author: Nick Iaquinto
comment: I have the moto 360 and it works mostly. The stream works great and it is a good quality. I can't take a picture from the watch. I also can't switch from back to front without closing and reopening the watch app. I would have rated this lower but it is the only app like it so it is fine. It is definitely worth it. Devs: please fix the picture taking problem!

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content:
Thank you for the feedback!
Could you please confirm for me what happens when you tap the screen to take a picture? Does nothing happen or do you not end up with a saved picture? Please search for home/DCIM/Camera and see if anything was saved there.
I'd love to help in greater detail if you email me at my listed address.

title: It Kinda works

author: Long Le
comment: Works pretty good. The quality is not great and slight lag but otherwise really cool. The photo that saves to phone is high res. Wish they had option to turn the flash on to work like a flashlight. Would be helpful if using the phone in dark places.

author: Huy Pham
comment: Have to update because this app keeps getting worse. There is severe lag and viewfinder often freezes. The image on my watch is definitely not a "live" image.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: I'm sorry to see you're having issues. Could you please email me so I can give you personal assistance and fix this problem? To be able to help I'd need to know which phone+watch and which OS versions you are using. Also if you could be so kind please let me know if you have already tried clearing the app data?

title: Update

author: Kendal Hoban
comment: Works on my test devices (moto 360 and gear live) and works but the camera feed can get pretty laggy at times or just hang alltogether. When this doesn't happen its a great app to have.
title: Functionality is there usually but isn't always consistent

author: Armando Buenaventura
comment: I did not give up, seeing all the users were able to make it work. I continued on playing with re=set/re start, install re install and somehow it is working now. Let's see how long will it work as the other reviewers said it stop working after a few days. For now I am giving this 4 stars, it is a great and useful app when it is working. 5 stars for developer's support.    I managed to get a refund, but then I decided to give it a chance so I re  purchased, re installed, clear the cache, re started my One M9, re started the watch, re sync, all the  possible re! So please refund me, I gave it a chance, I wasted a lot of time trying to make it it work. Please give my money back. Thanks

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: Thank you for the edit and your perseverance in the matter. I hope you have no further issues with the app and will happily assist you further (or refund manually) if you do. Sending an email to my listed address will ensure I can respond to you quickly.

author: Robert Alexander
comment: Love that I can finally take a pic and see it from my watch but real laggy and hard to see on moto 360 but yet again I give full credit to these people I can't make a app so good job just update to fix please also can not use stock camera for pictures seems to override it with this app
title: Great concept

author: Joshua Catekista
comment: Only downfall is quality on the watch is low.  But view comes up and takes pictures no problem.  LG G3 + LG Watch Urbane
title: Works fine

author: paul richman
comment: On my Tag Heuer Connected.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: I looked into the crash report from your device. The app crashes when trying to connect to the camera. Could you please uninstall the app and try again? I would also like to ask you: are you running the stock OS on your note5 or a custom rom? If send a message to the support email I can help you solve this more quickly.

title: Fails to open

author: Kelvin Goh
comment: Is a worse app that i ever purchased please refund my money. Wasting my time and effort to download.
title: Can't even take picture

author: Dimas Jr
comment: I tried... But it is not working with huawei mate 8 and Sony smartwatch 3 ... I can hear the snap of the photo... But no saved pictures
title: Does not work with mate 8 and sw3

author: A F
comment: Doesn't work with my note 5 and asus zenwatch 2. Settings won't work. It also won't take pictures. I have checked the correct directory.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: Apologies for the inconvenience. With Samsung/HTC devices the app does not save pictures into the correct directory. The solution for this is to use a file browser app (I recommend "ES file explorer") and go to home/DCIM/Camera, you will find the pictures there.

title: Doesn't work

author: David Dodge
comment: The app isn't appearing on my watch at all, even after waiting about 15 minutes, and after re-syncing the apps.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content:
I'm sorry to read you're having problems.
Could you please clear the app-data and then remove the app from your phone and lastly re-install it.
It is a relatively common problem, the only way to fix a "corrupted install" is by completely re-doing it.

I'm sure this will fix the problem, there has never been a case where the app simply won't work.

title: No Watch Interaction

author: Munawwarah Sapuan
comment: Unable to use with front camera with samsung note 8. Is ot anywhere you can advice on this

author: BC BC
comment: Last update is causing this not to work.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: There was no update to this app this month. If the app won't work properly for you after an android wear update, please reinstall the app to fix the problem.

title: Please fix.

author: satyageet jadhav
comment: Not able to switch front camera..  very disappointed...

author: Alex Melton
comment: As it is its a relitvly bad camera app for my phone.. It doesn't connect to the moto 360(or I haven't found out how to) and the settings button doesn't work. If I can't get it to work I'll refund but if so I'll rate 5  (thanks in advance to any replies)     UPDATE - I tried to reinstall and its making me pay for it again..

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content:
- To properly use this app you start it from the watch. The phone side of the app simply facilitates the use of the camera and is not intended to interact with.

- Google has full control over play store behaviour. You can not buy an app twice through the store unless you cancelled it the first time.

title: It doesn't really work

author: MönkéhyBloöd 3245
comment: Is it possible to make it record using the watch as a start and stop with out making sound?
title: Works perfectly

author: david dark
comment: I take 2 picture, has no picture has been save to my Galaxy S. Please advise.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: Apologies for the inconvenience. With Samsung devices the app does not save pictures into the correct directory. The solution for this is to use a file browser app (I recommend "ES file explorer") and go to home/DCIM/Camera, you will find the pictures there.

title: No picture has been save

author: Jay Jayasuriya
comment: I've been waiting for something like this!. Love it so far.
title: So cool

author: Gokhan Gokmen
comment: What about video option?
title: Any new stuff?

author: Hesham Hegazy
comment: Do what's needed
title: Love it

author: Ra Jo
comment: Please add video support!

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content:
Thanks for the vote of confidence and for supporting my future development endeavours!
I'm working on a complete remake of this app to include not only video support, but a fully featured phone-side app and higher quality stream to the watch. Please stay tuned for more on this in the coming months

title: Awesome app.

author: Sebastian Turner
comment: Very good

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content:
Please try to re-install the app. If that doesn't help please message me which ROM you're using on your OnePlus One.
We have never before seen any crashes. It might be caused by a 3rd party android OS.

author: Payton Standfill
comment: Only worked 30% of the time I tried it :/. Uninstalled :(, waste of money, but kudos to the dev for trying!
title: Potential...

author: Alex Negrete
comment: I was looking for an app similar to this but was not satisfied with it. I am sorry to say that I would like a refund.

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: I replied to your email in greater detail. Refunds are handled through the store page by clicking on the refund button. This is only available for a limited time after purchasing the app.

title: Please read

author: Sean Bentley
comment: It would turn on the camera, it would show me the viewfinder, but when I tap on the watch to take the picture it didn't take the pic. I use an LG urbane and a htc one m8

reply.author: JonG Mobile Apps
reply.content: Images made with this app are saved in /sdcard/DCIM/Camera. for most devices this is the default camera folder but for devices from for example Samsung and HTC this is a different folder.

title: Wouldn't save pictures

author: christopher king
comment: Picture on g watch urban is horrible compared to the stock camera app
title: Lg g4

author: Luke Mayes
comment: No
